channel.title: Tham Le's Notes
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Tham Le's Notes

item.title: android_rdp_keyboard
item.description: Capturing Virtual Keyboard Input for Remote Desktop on Android The Problem You’re building a remote desktop client (RDP, VNC, or similar) on Android.

item.title: encoding_protocol_design
item.description: Designing Flexible Character Encoding for Remote Desktop What Android Actually Uses Java (and therefore Android/Kotlin) uses UTF-16 as the internal representation for String objects in memory.

item.title: virtual-keycode
item.description: The user is asking about the fundamental difference between virtual keycodes and Unicode characters.

item.title: why-utf-32
item.description: Excellent Point: Why Not UTF-8 Everywhere? You’re absolutely right to challenge this design choice.

item.title: Winit-Key-Reference
item.description: Excellent. That is the most important piece of information you could have given me.

item.title: Work-Related Overview
item.description: libkynput Project - Development Notes This folder contains technical notes and implementation guides for the libkynput project - a Rust library for cross-platform keyboard and mouse input capture and injection, used in remote desktop and game streaming applications.

item.title: Unicode-Goal
item.description: Unicode Input Support Issue: Add support for “unicode” input Created: 3 days ago by Simon Latapie Status: Open Android Virtual Keyboard ↓ TextWatcher (afterTextChanged) ↓ KyberPlayerView.sendUnicodeInput() ↓ LibVLC.onUnicodeInput() ↓ JNI: nativeOnUnicodeInput() ↓ libkynput_unicode_to_packet() [Rust ...

item.title: Unicode-Implementation-Across-All-Layers
item.description: Overview Here’s every function/file you need to create or modify to add Unicode support to libkynput, organized by layer from bottom (protocol) to top (UI).

item.title: Unicode-Implementation-Guide
item.description: Based on the existing keyboard implementation, here’s how to add Unicode input support while maintaining the exact same coding style and architecture.
